key thing of um of cosmos db is
partitioning so partitioning is necessary to optimize
both your reads and writes it doesn't make that much difference when you're working on a small
set of data but it comes it becomes really critical when you're when you're
working at scale the reason for that is the more data that's in there or the
more or the the bigger your data set is the more your data is spread across
sorry across what is called a physical partition a physical partition is
yeah something physical you can see it as a computer so it's it's ssd storage
and compute so cosmos db is distributing your data
across those uh physical partition but
um those are an internal implementation of cosmos db
as a developer or as a person working with with cosmos db
you should not focus too much on physical partition because
it's completely out of your control it's it's managed by by cosmos db so
you don't have to worry about that however you need to be aware of
how they are working how how things are are working
there is however a way to control partitioning of your data across those
physical partition and the way that it's done is through what is called a logical
partition and cosmos db is working with that logical partition it's grouping all the data
uh that has the same partition key it's grouping that data together and
spreading that across physical um physical partition so if we
take our movies example um you would have something like this so there's a
possibility that there's multiple partition within your cosmos db account so i i've took
partition 1 partition 2 and partition n and you see that because the fact we've chosen um
[Music] release here as a partition key um
he will group those those entities or those data together and he will keep them together and
spread them across your physical partition so um as data becomes uh as there is
more data being added on on top of your cosmos db you can see that the amount of
physical partitions can grow and your data is being spread across that
across those physical partitions however your logical partition um
uh will always be together and that's important for uh querying data

mean that you will be charged uh more on top of that
because how cosmos db is working um or what is being advised when querying
it's um the the advice there is to uh
at most as possible try to include the partition key within your queries as the aim there is to um the best
practice is to try to hit one one partition or yeah one partition
with your query as that will be faster and cheaper because uh
you are as within cosmos db you're being charged on what is called request units
and that's uh a computation of uh how many time your uh
how long did your query run and how many uh resources you consumed for that query
so it's important to really target that single partition as it will be faster and cheaper for you to
to to query that data so talking about querying it's um

different so the goal there or should be is putting entities together so that you
have all the data that you need for your application in a single query
